Venture capitalists were of the opinion that he was too young to receive funding for his project. He then came in contact with the founders of Celltribe and was able to start to develop mobile service applications. Along came a famous little bubble and the source of funding dried up from Ã–resund Capital.

After high school, Marcus decided not go straight for university and took employment as Key account manager at Travel Media Group where he was responsible for Xpress Magazine, the onboard magazine of Arlanda Express. It was under this time at Travelmedia Joel Jacobson, Johan Zetterberg draw the first sketches for Redbet that Marcus co-founded. Redbet is a sports betting and poker company. The company is publically traded on the Swedish OMX First north.

During the Redbet time, Marcus and fellow entrepreneur Johan Wilsson founded Oddsmanager.com, one of the first odds comparison services in world. The company collected real time odds for the 100 largest events from gambling companies in real time, shared the data with larger online portals and then sold placements to the gambling companies. After legal warnings from Swedish gambling authorities the company had to be liquidated, lesson learned.

A short time after the events with the Swedish gambling authorities, Marcus decided to contribute to the prevention of young people getting caught in drug abuse. SafeTest was founded. Safetest is a sale and marketing company distributing medical testing equipment to municipalities, companies and individual consumers. The companyâ€™s core product is a new way of drug testing by hair analysis. This method of drug testing is a preferred method for government authorities in Sweden.

Marcus than was offered the hard to refuse position as Sales and marketing manager at Folkia. The company was then a recently started Norwegian financial institute providing every day financial services specializing in short-term loans. The task given to Marcus by the Icelandic founder and chairman HÃ¶rdur Bender was to make Folkia the leading company in its class, which it as a matter of fact now is. Today Folkia has 150 000 customers from its operations in all the Nordic countries and Estonia. In the year of 2009 Folkia had a turnover of 115MM NOK with 18 MM NOK in revenue. The company was recently acquired by the NASDAQ listed consumer finance group, Dollar Financial Corp.
